spanishExample: ¡Mírame! ¡Quiero que ella viva donde quiere vivir!
englishTranslation: Look at me! I want her to live where she wants to live!
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mírame: look at me (Mirar, imperative contraction)
viva: live, he/she/it live (Vivir, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¡No lo mires! No es seguro de sí mismo.
englishTranslation: Don’t look at him! He isn’t sure of himself.
vocabIncluded: seguro de sí mismo: sure of oneself (idiom)

spanishExample: De todas formas, está cerca del fuego porque es seguro de sí mismo.
englishTranslation: In any case, he’s near the fire because he’s sure of himself.
vocabIncluded: cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
seguro de sí mismo: sure of oneself (idiom)

spanishExample: Él necesitaba mirar el lugar donde vives.
englishTranslation: He needed to look at the place where you live.
vocabIncluded: necesitaba: needed, he/she/it needed (Necesitar, imperfect, 3rd person)
vives: live, you live (Vivir, present, 2nd person)

englishTranslation: I hope they look at it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
espero:  hope/wait/expect, I  hope/wait/expect  (Esperar, present, 1st person)
miren: look, they look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Estoy viviendo con solo cuatro de estas cosas.
englishTranslation: I’m living with only four of these things.

spanishExample: Hace buen tiempo, así que ella no necesita siete de esos.
englishTranslation: The weather is good, so she doesn’t need seven of those.

spanishExample: Me da igual si miras ese lugar.
englishTranslation: It’s all the same to me if you look at that place.
vocabIncluded: me da igual: it's all the same to me (idiom)
miras: look, you look (Mirar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Me da igual, pueden hacerlo por sí mismos.
englishTranslation: I don’t care, they can do it by themselves.
vocabIncluded: me da igual: it's all the same to me (idiom)

spanishExample: Mira la cama donde vivía antes.
englishTranslation: She looks at the bed where she used to live before.
vocabIncluded: vivía: lived, I lived (Vivir, imperfect, 1st person)

spanishExample: Necesitamos que mires cinco cosas donde vivimos.
englishTranslation: We need you to look at five things where we live.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mires: look, you look (Mirar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
necesitamos: need, we need (Necesitar, present, 1st person plural)
vivimos: live, we live (Vivir, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Necesito que sea seguro de sí mismo.
englishTranslation: I need him to be sure of himself.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)
seguro de sí mismo: sure of oneself (idiom)

spanishExample: No quiero que mire a mis seis perros.
englishTranslation: I don’t want him to look at my six dogs.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
"the personal a": using an extra "a" before a direct object when it's a person
mire: look, he/she/it look (Mirar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No vivo con cinco amigos, vivo con seis.
englishTranslation: I don’t live with five friends, I live with six.
vocabIncluded: vivo: live, I live (Vivir, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Pueden necesitar siete si lo van a hacer por sí mismos.
englishTranslation: They might need seven if they are going to do it by themselves.
vocabIncluded: using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Puedes tener siete, me da igual, yo tengo cuatro.
englishTranslation: You can have seven, it’s all the same to me, I have four.
vocabIncluded: me da igual: it's all the same to me (idiom)

spanishExample: Quiere que viva con cuatro niños.
englishTranslation: She wants me to live with four kids.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
viva: live, he/she/it live (Vivir, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Son seis personas y no tienen problemas entre sí.
englishTranslation: They are six people and they don’t have problems among themselves.

spanishExample: Viven en un lugar donde hay café a las cinco de la mañana.
englishTranslation: They live in a place where there is coffee at five in the morning.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
viven: live, they live (Vivir, present, 3rd person plural)
